stanza.line: My mistress eyes are nothing like the sunsun
Coral is far more red than her lips redred
If snow be white why then her breasts are dundun
If hairs be wires black wires grow on her headhead
I have seen roses damasked red and whitewhite
But no such roses see I in her cheekscheeks
And in some perfumes is there more delightdelight
Than in the breath that from my mistress reeksreeks
I love to hear her speak yet well I knowknow
That music hath a far more pleasing soundsound
I grant I never saw a goddess gogo
My mistress when she walks treads on the groundground
And yet by heaven I think my love as rarerare
As any she belied with false comparecompare
